Luciana Aparecida Reis

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5068271292622167
  • Última atualização do currículo em 19/07/2019

Realizou sua Graduação em Enfermagem pela Escola de Enfermagem Wenceslau Bráz de Itajubá, (1995). Realizou o Mestrado em Ciências - Área Nefrologia pela Disciplina de Nefrologia do Departamento de Medicina da UNIFESP/EPM (2008). Realizou o Doutorado em Ciências - Área Nefrologia pela Disciplina de Nefrologia do Departamento de Medicina da UNIFESP/EPM (2012). Concluiu Pós Doutorado em Ciências pela Disciplina de Nefrologia do Departamento de Medicina da UNIFESP/EPM (2016). Atuando nos seguintes temas: Células-tronco Mesenquimais, Células Progenitoras Renais, Exosomas, Lesão Renal Aguda e Nefrotoxicidade Aguda por Gentamicina, LPS e Cisplatina. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2016 - Atual
Study on the serum CA125 in patients with acute myocardium right ventricular and lower wall.
Descrição: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) of the right ventricle (RV) is considerate a rare event, but when associated with down left ventricle, the incidence increase, being able to get to 38%. Therefore, its occurrence is associated with high mortality rates due to common complications such as cardiogenic shock and ventricular failure, leading to a poor outcome in these patients. Thus, early identification of serum levels of cardiac necrosis biomarkers becomes an important tool that may contribute to the detection of these possible complications so that interventional measures can be performed more quickly and safely to the patient. Tumor biomarkers such as antigen 125 (CA125) are known to be widely used in the detection and control of solid tumors, however, recent studies have demonstrated a great relationship the CA125 with dilated cardiomyopathies, but its relation with RV and lower wall AMI remains unknown..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Luciana Aparecida Reis - Coordenador / ANDRESSA ALMEIDA GONÇALVES - Integrante / ARILDO PIMENTEL MENDES - Integrante / VALDINÉIA SOUZA BARBOSA - Integrante.
2016 - Atual
APACHE IV in the outcome evaluation of discharge in patients submitted to therapeutic hypothermia after cardiac arrest.
Descrição: Cardiorespiratory arrest (CRP) is considered to be a sudden and sudden interruption of the systemic circulation and spontaneous breathing. Thus, early initiation of resuscitation maneuvers may contribute significantly to the occurrence of potentially irreversible brain damage. Therefore, providing resources that minimize deleterious effects to the brain as therapeutic hypothermia (TH) becomes an important tool for improving morbidity and mortality outcomes in these patients. The Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation IV (APACHE IV) score was developed to estimate the severity of the disease and predict mortality in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) in adults. Changes in APACHE IV during hospitalization indicate improvement or worsening in the clinical status of ICU patients, and can be used as an outcome measure for the evaluation of interventions..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Luciana Aparecida Reis - Coordenador / ANDRESSA ALMEIDA GONÇALVES - Integrante / ARILDO PIMENTEL MENDES - Integrante / VALDINÉIA SOUZA BARBOSA - Integrante.
2016 - Atual
Evaluation of APACHE IV in patients submitted or not to thrombolytic therapy in acute ischemic stroke.
Descrição: Ischemic stroke is a highly relevant event due to frequent complications and a high incidence of mortality. Thus, providing therapeutic resources such as thrombolysis that minimizes the damage to patients affected by this disease, becomes important. Thrombolysis, when administered within the therapeutic window, is known to prevent sequelae that may be irreversible and potentially fatal. Thrombolysis, when administered within the therapeutic window, It is known to prevent sequelae that may be irreversible and potentially fatal. There is no study comparing comparison of the APACHE IV score in patients submitted or not to thrombolization after AVEi..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Luciana Aparecida Reis - Coordenador / ANDRESSA ALMEIDA GONÇALVES - Integrante / ARILDO PIMENTEL MENDES - Integrante / VALDINÉIA SOUZA BARBOSA - Integrante.
2015 - 2016
The evaluation of Therapeutic Intervention Scoring Sistem?28 (TISS-28) score on adult?s patients with ventilator-associated pneumonia in intensive care unit.
Descrição: Pneumonia is considered an infection of the lower respiratory tract that compromises the airways and pulmonary parenchyma, with or without consolidation of the alveolar spaces. Ventilator-associated pneumonia (VAP) represents an incidence around 15% and a mortality rate of 38%, being considered a frequent occurrence in intensive care units (ICUs). However, the need for preventive actions that need to be adopted by the intensive care team is focused on actions that minimize its incidence high and mortality. Thus, the Therapeutic Intervention Scoring System-28 score (TISS-28) is considered an instrument that quantifies the therapeutic interventions according to the complexity, degree of invasive vascular accesses and the time spent by the nursing in the performance of individualized procedures to the intensive patient. However, there are no studies that relate the clinical evolution of patients with VAP classified according to the TISS-28 score..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) .

Integrantes: Luciana Aparecida Reis - Coordenador / Nayara Helem Gomes Pereira - Integrante / Camila Alves Moreira - Integrante / Kelsy Catherina Nema Areco - Integrante.
2015 - 2016
Use of Calendula officinalis and Aloe barbadensis in wound healing.
Descrição: Acompanhar a evolução do processo de cicatrização de feridas tratadas com (Aloe barbadensis), (Calêndula officinalis) ou curativos preconizados pela cartilha SUS em pacientes que estejam em tratamento no Centro de Saúde de Campinas-SP..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) .

Integrantes: Luciana Aparecida Reis - Coordenador / Juliana A Albuquerque - Integrante / Josivan B Amorin - Integrante / Regina Grimaldi - Integrante.
2015 - 2016
Occupational risks of the pre-hospital emergency medical services workers.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (3) .

Integrantes: Luciana Aparecida Reis - Coordenador / Ane Sulivande Araujo Pereira - Integrante / Regina Fonseca Peixoto - Integrante.
2011 - 2012
Qualidade de vida dos pacientes com lesão renal aguda e doença renal crônica (DRC) conservadora ou terminal ou agudizada.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) / Mestrado acadêmico: (1) / Doutorado: (1) .
